search_information.query_displayed: How Money Matters: The Effect of School District Spending on Academic Achievement. Wenglinsky, Harold Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: How money matters: The effect of school district spending on academic achievement
organic_results.snippet: Because of the prestige of the Coleman Report, few sociologists of education assert that school spending is associated with students' achievement. Instead, most either emphasize the influence of school social environment or question the ability of schools to make any difference. The study presented here applied LISREL to a new database synthesized from the 1992 National Assessment of Educational Progress in mathematics for eighth graders and the Common Core of Data for the universe of US school districts to test the hypothesis …

publication_info.summary: H Wenglinsky - Sociology of education, 1997 - JSTOR
